title: Digital Type
content:
Does anyone have any suggestions off the top of their head of some good “digital looking” typefaces? I’m basically looking for something that you feel expresses the concept of time, or timecode.

 [‹ A Children's Playground of Lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805181208/http:/typophile.com/node/19121 "Go to previous forum topic") [Tiger with Windows ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805181208/http:/typophile.com/node/19052 "Go to next forum topic")
author: biddy

comments.content:
I’m not sure if I’m understanding your request correctly, but here are a few that suggest timecode, but not sure about expressing the concept of time itself...

FF Alega  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufac...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805181208/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11310.0.0 "http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.11310.0.0")

Clicker  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font\_categori...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070805181208/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Clicker "http://www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font\_categories=1&font\_categories\_search=font\_name\_search&searchstr=Clicker")
Well, I guess the best way to say it is something that looks “dot-matrixy,” “digital clocky,” on “monospacey.” :)
